abstract: Warren E Buffett responds to Rep Tim Huelskamp, who asked for Buffett to release his tax returns after Buffett called for higher taxes on wealthy individuals; he paid $6.9 million in federal income taxes in 2010, representing 17.4 percent of his $39.8 million in taxable income.
snippet: In pushing for the White House to raise levies on the wealthy, Warren E. Buffett reiterated that the percentage is too low compared to what his own staff members pay.
lead_paragraph: In pushing for the White House to raise levies on the wealthy, Warren E. Buffett reiterated that the percentage is too low compared to what his own staff members pay.

headline.main: In Response to Lawmaker, Buffett Claims 17.4% Tax Rate
headline.print_headline: In Response To Lawmaker, Buffett Claims 17.4% Tax Rate
headline.seo: In Letter to Congressman, Buffett Claims 17.4% Tax Rate
